intro: Thunbergia bequaertii, commonly known as the African bluebell, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its striking blue or purple tubular flowers. The plant features heart-shaped leaves and is often cultivated for its ornamental value. It thrives in warm, humid climates and requires well-drained soil. Thunbergia bequaertii is typically grown as an annual or tender perennial in gardens and greenhouses.
